Class HumanPlayer

java.lang.Object
Player
HumanPlayer
public class HumanPlayer
extends Player
This class represents a type of player, a human player.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Player

    lookRange, playerCoords, validCommandsArray

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    HumanPlayer​(Coordinate playerCoords, java.util.ArrayList<Command> validCommandsArray)
    The constructor initialises a human player with the coordinate they are in and the array of commands that they accept

  • Constructor Details

    • HumanPlayer

      public HumanPlayer​(Coordinate playerCoords, java.util.ArrayList<Command> validCommandsArray)
      The constructor initialises a human player with the coordinate they are in and the array of commands that they accept
      Parameters:
      playerCoords - Coordinate which represents the player's coordinate
      validCommandsArray - ArrayList of Commands which contains the commands this player accepts

  • Method Details

    • nextAction

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> nextAction()
      Implementation of the abstract method which is how a human player does an action. It asks for a user input from the consule and loops through each of the commands the player has and checks whether it has the correct command name and arguments.
      Specified by:
      nextAction in class Player
      Returns:
      List of strings which contains the command name and its arguments that the player made.

    • handleCommandCallback

      public void handleCommandCallback​(java.lang.String commandName, java.lang.String returnVal)
      Implementation of the abstract method which is how a human player deals with the return of an action. The human just prints the returnVal to the consule for the user to see.
      Specified by:
      handleCommandCallback in class Player
      Parameters:
      commandName - String containing the command name the player made
      returnVal - String containing the return value of the command the player has called

    • isHuman

      public boolean isHuman()
      Implementation of the abstract method which is whether the player is human or not, returns true.
      Specified by:
      isHuman in class Player
      Returns:
      boolean true

    • getPlayerChar

      public char getPlayerChar()
      Implementation of the abstract method which is to get the player's character
      Specified by:
      getPlayerChar in class Player
      Returns:
      character 'P'
